Package board

Class Board

java.lang.Object
board.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
The board class initializes the board and pieces. The board is a 2-d 8X8 array. The pieces are initialized stored in standard starting positions on the board. There are several helper methods which are used to properly print the board.
Since:
2022-03-22
Version:
1.0
Author:
Afaq Qamar (aq101), Suryateja Gandhesiri (sg1571)

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static Piece[][] board
    board is a 2-d array that will store all pieces.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Board()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static int[] convertCords​(java.lang.String input)
    This method converts String to integers the board can understand i.e e2 will be converted to 4 2
    static void init()
    This method is used to initialize the board 2-d array by setting all spots to null by default.
    static void printBoard()
    This method prints the board according to the pattern specified by using the 2-d board array, printPatter() method, and the piece objects within the array
    static void printPattern​(int x, int y)
    This method prints the pattern used in the printBoard() method to match the required board structure

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • board

      public static Piece[][] board
      board is a 2-d array that will store all pieces.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()

  • Method Details

    • init

      public static void init()
      This method is used to initialize the board 2-d array by setting all spots to null by default. Then each piece object is created and stored in correct order and spot Board is read like this 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7

    • printPattern

      public static void printPattern​(int x, int y)
      This method prints the pattern used in the printBoard() method to match the required board structure
      Parameters:
      x - This is the x-coordinate
      y - This is the y-coordinate

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard()
      This method prints the board according to the pattern specified by using the 2-d board array, printPatter() method, and the piece objects within the array

    • convertCords

      public static int[] convertCords​(java.lang.String input)
      This method converts String to integers the board can understand i.e e2 will be converted to 4 2
      Parameters:
      input - This is the only input and represents the String version of the Piece's coordinates
      Returns:
      int[] This method returns an integer array of the String cord converted to numbers
